trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Beott welcomes you to the village of Tomra.

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_SEQ_01<tab>Beott welcomes you to the village of Tomra with a hearty “lali-ho.” To her dismay, however, it seems that her son, Ronitt, risks becoming a social outcast for his reluctance to maintain the same level of dwarven etiquette. She begs you to befriend the unfriendly boy, hoping that the rarity of a stranger's presence will help draw Ronitt out of his thorny shell...
※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_SEQ_02<tab>Beott introduces you to Ronitt, and the rebellious lad responds to the simplest interactions with snarls and posturing. Following your attempts at a brief “conversation,” it becomes clear that Ronitt has misplaced a family heirloom once belonging to a famous blacksmith. Beott sends the boy off to continue the search, and asks you to question villagers on the hammer's whereabouts.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_SEQ_03<tab>You speak with an affable townsdwarf. He commends you on your fine dwarven manners before pointing out another villager who may have picked up the hammer in question.

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_SEQ_04<tab>You soon learn that the timid townsdwarf did indeed retrieve Ronitt's carelessly misplaced heirloom. Taking charge of the hammer, you set off to return it to its owner.

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_SEQ_05<tab>You hand the hammer back to Ronitt, who grudgingly admits that you may not be the worst person he's ever met after all. Beott once more urges you to be a friend to her son, before leaving the two of you alone in uncomfortable companionship...
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Beott.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_TODO_01<tab>Speak with the affable townsdwarf.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_TODO_02<tab>Speak with the timid townsdwarf.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_TODO_03<tab>Deliver Watts's hammer to Ronitt.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_000<tab>Well scuff my helm, if it ain't that traveler we've been hearing about! And the elder's had more'n a few things to say!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_001<tab>Well scuff my helm, if it ain't that foreign dwarf we've been hearing about! Well, well, well, well!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_002<tab>I'd best be giving you a proper welcome then, eh? Lali-ho!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_A1_000_001<tab>Lali-ho!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_003<tab>Now that's what I like to see─a “lali-ho” straight from the heart!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_004<tab>...To be expected, I suppose─outsiders can't never get the greeting right the first time! Never mind, never mind!

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_005<tab>I only wish my own boy would put a bit more effort into his “lalis” and his “hos.” He's always busy fiddling with his damn automata; no time for swapping words with folk of flesh and blood.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_006<tab>Every dwarf knows that a “lali-ho” gets a “lali-ho,” or you're asking to become an outcast... A mother does worry, she does.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_007<tab>And that's only the half of it! I know it's just a stage all lads go through, but the little bugger has to argue with every word I say!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_008<tab>...Oh, I've just had the most clever idea!

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_009<tab>He'll not listen to me or the other villagers, but maybe─just maybe─curiosity for a stranger will win out over that sour attitude of his. Worth a try, don't you think?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_010<tab>Please, befriend my son, Ronitt. Just...get him used to giving a proper greeting. That's all I ask.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_011<tab>And I tell you, he really is a marvel with automata! If you end up getting along, he might even show you a few of his stranger contraptions!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_020<tab>Roooniiitt! Look, we've got a visitor! Why don't you say hello?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_021<tab>Who're you, then?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_100_021<tab>What!? You got somethin' to say to me!?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_Q2_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_A2_000_001<tab>Lali-ho!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_A2_000_002<tab>Hi-ho!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_A2_000_003<tab>Rally-ho!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_022<tab>Oh...you...know our greeting... Hmph.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_023<tab>Huh? Th-That's not how we... Hmph.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_024<tab>What kinda greeting is that!? A-Are you tryin' to impress me, or somethin'? I... Hmph.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_025<tab>L-Lali... <mumble> <mumble>
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_026<tab>Oh, Ronitt, my lad, you can do better than that! Head up, eyes front! No need to be shy!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_027<tab>I-I'm not bein' shy! I'm <var 1A 02 /var>stoic<var 1A 01 /var>!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_028<tab>Yes, dear, if you say so. Now, Ronitt, is everything else alright? You seemed to be looking for something...?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_029<tab>Oh, no, it's just... I mean, I sorta...lost my hammer.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_030<tab>You WHAT!? Of all the irresponsible, careless, foolish...
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_031<tab>Ronitt's hammer has been in the family for generations! It's a priceless heirloom that once belonged to Watts, the blacksmith of legend himself!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_032<tab>Well, what're you standing around for, boy! Find that hammer! <var 1A 02 /var>We<var 1A 01 /var> will do what we can to help.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_033<tab>Right, why don't you have a chat with some villagers for me and ask if they've seen Ronitt's hammer. Just remember your dwarven manners, and all will be well!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_034<tab>Odd, I swear I was just holdin' it...
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_035<tab>Hm? What're you starin' at, eh!? Clear off!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERA03556_000_040<tab>You want words with me, then?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_Q3_000_000<tab>What will you do?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_A3_000_001<tab>Give a dwarven greeting.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_A3_000_002<tab>Give an Eorzean greeting.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERA03556_000_041<tab>Oho! That's a fine “lali-ho” you've got there, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>. I like you!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERA03556_000_042<tab>...Hm? <var 08 E905 ((She's)) ((He's)) /var> trying to tell me something, I just know it...
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERA03556_000_043<tab>Ronitt...? Ah, that sulky sprout's lost old Watts's hammer, has he? Well lucky for him, I believe yon gentledwarf picked it up!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERA03556_000_044<tab>It's time I was getting back to work, then. Good day to you, stranger!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERB03556_000_050<tab>Y-You...you're talking to m-me?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_Q4_000_000<tab>What will you do?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_A4_000_001<tab>Give a dwarven greeting.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_A4_000_002<tab>Give a Far Eastern greeting.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERB03556_000_051<tab>Wh-What's this!? A perfect “lali-ho”!? Y-You're no ordinary traveler, I see!

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERB03556_000_052<tab>Argh! Wh-Why is <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> showing me the top of <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> h-head!? Has <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> no <var 1A 02 /var>shame<var 1A 01 /var>!?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERB03556_000_053<tab>...The h-hammer I picked up? Aye, I reckoned I would hand it over to the elder for safekeeping. Y-You're saying it belongs to young R-Ronitt?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERB03556_000_054<tab>Well, h-he can be a touch sh-shouty, that boy... D-Do you think you could take it back to him for m-me?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_VILLAGERB03556_000_055<tab>Th-That's my part d-done, then!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_060<tab>Huh? Why are you still here!?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_061<tab>Wait! This...this is my hammer!!!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_062<tab>Well, well, well, well. Would you look at that!

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_063<tab>You see, Ronitt? Give the right and proper greeting, and folk'll be glad to share a bit of kindness. Could be that you've a thing or two to learn from <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> here.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_064<tab><var 1A 02 /var>Huh<var 1A 01 /var>!? Are you lecturin' me again!?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_065<tab>Aye, well, maybe... Maybe you're not such a bad sort.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_100_065<tab>I'll just put the hammer in a safe place somewhere... I mean to be a famous smitty myself someday, so I'd best not lose it again!

TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_066<tab>I'll leave you to it, then. I know my boy's not the easiest to get along with, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, but he could sure use a friend like you!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_067<tab>I don't need a friend! I don't need anyone!
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_068<tab>We...we're not goin' to be friends, understand!? But you can stay around a little longer. If you want.
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_RONITT_000_069<tab>S-So, now what!?
TEXT_LUCKZI101_03556_BEOTT_000_070<tab>Well, now, what's that you've got there?
